comment: The single best professor I have ever had at KSU. She is very considerate, very timely in responses and the class as a whole is easy. Do yourself a favor and take her.

There were quizzes, PackBack discussions, a group project, and a final. The group project was 50% of the grade, and the directions for the project were terrible and confusing. The directions didn't line up with what the professor said she wanted in the assignment submission feedback. She contradicted what her ow directions said. Tough grader too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Warren is incredible and so kind! Quizzes are open note and straight from the book; just read and take notes and you'll do great! There is a project that takes some time but it isn't bad at all. Highly recommend this Professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is the best professor teaching this course. I would recommend Professor Warren a million times over. With an already stressful semester due to graduation, she made this class enjoyable which really made the content more digestible. She is always available if you need help or have questions. Amazing professor.

Professor Warren was absolutely amazing. Definitely my favorite teacher at KSU. She makes the class interesting . the quizzes and test are open note and not hard. There is one project you must do, but it is easy and you actually learn a lot from it so don't stress. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Professor Warren was my 2nd favorite professor at KSU behind Professor McCulloch. She was very responsive & lets you text her which is so much easier and faster. She is a very fair grader and was genuinely so nice. She even let you opt out of the final if you were content with your grade. 10/10 professor and 2/10 difficulty level. Highly recommend.

Great Professor!! I enjoyed learning about this class especially because hospitality and tourism industry is the field I want to pursue. 3 discussion posts, 4 experimental exercise papers, quizzes are not hard. All of the information can be found in the book. And one project that you can work on throughout the semester. Only exam is the final
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things
